pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

descript.abstract: United States Military Installations is a polygon theme representing the boundaries and location information for important military installations in the United States and Puerto Rico. The database includes records for 405 military installations.
descript.purpose: To provide graphic representation, location and attribute data for analysis, modeling and simulation, and studies. CLOSURE, REALIGN, and BRAC columns are from the office of Economic Adjustment and OSD websites at http://www.oea.gov, https://www.denix.osd.mil.

cntorgp.cntorg: Surface Deployment and Distribution Command Transportation Engineering Agency (SDDCTEA)

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

attracc.attraccr: Attributes for the military installations database were added using a Geographic Information System (GIS). Attribute values were created by the Surface Deployment and Distribution Command Transportation Engineering Agency (SDDCTEA), and were compiled from unclassified sources such as the "Geolocation File." They have been quality reviewed by both SDDCTEA and the Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS).

dataqual.logic: All node-link and polygon topological relationships are created and verified using computer algorithms. Unique entity identifiers were similarly verified using ArcInfo.
dataqual.complete: The United States Military Installations database contains the boundaries and location information for important military installations in the United States and Puerto Rico. The database includes records for 405 military installations.

horizpa.horizpar: The Military installation database was compiled from TIGER/Line data having a positional accuracy measure of +/- 80m for the contiguous 48 States plus Washington D.C and Hawaii. TIGER/Line files for Puerto Rico and Alaska were compiled at a scale of 1:125,000.

citeinfo.title: TIGER/Line Digital Data Files
citeinfo.othercit: Installation boundaries derived from TIGER data and aligned with Installation CAD data.

procstep.procdesc: Military installation boundaries were added from TIGER data and topologically integrated. The dataset was checked for completeness and accuracy in ArcInfo and was converted to polygon shapefile format.

cntperp.cntorg: Military Traffic Management Command Transportation Engineering Agency (MTMCTEA)

enttyp.enttypd: Military Installations of the United States and Puerto Rico in a GIS format.
enttyp.enttypds: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

edom.edomvd: Polygonal Shapes as defined by ArcView

attr.attrdef: The name of the military installation.

codesetd.codesetn: List of Official Military Installation Names

attr.attrdef: The state or U.S. territory in which the military installation is located.

codesetd.codesetn: List of U.S. States and Territories

attr.attrdef: The abbreviation for the state or U.S. Territory in which the military facility is located. This is the two-letter official postal abbreviation.

codesetd.codesetn: List of Official US State and Territory Postal Abbreviations

attr.attrdef: The closure date of the installation due to a Base Realignment and Closure round
The realignment date of the installation due to a Base Realignment and Closure round
The round of Base Realignment and Closure that affected the installation

edom.edomvd: Facility operated by an organization not belonging to one of the seven "Branch" categories enumerated above.

attr.attrdef: The state FIPS code for the state or U.S. territory in which the military installation is located.
The VERSION is a 2-digit number that will be incremented for all records in the database whenever a new release is distributed.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

stdorder.ordering: Call (202-366-DATA), or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) RITA/BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2008 DVD.The NTAD cdrom can be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov. Individual datasets from the NTAD can also be downloaded from the Geographic Information Program web sit at http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/.

distinfo.techpreq: Software that can process GIS files.
